alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:39AM EST until December 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. For the Rockaway River...including Boonton Below Resvr...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River at Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 4.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 6.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.6 feet on 08/14/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 4.2 Mon 6 am 6.4 5.2 6.5 1am 12/19 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EST.
